title: Displacement Formula
text: The word “displacement” implies that an object has moved. The formula for displacement is as follows: △x $$=$$ $$x_f$$ - $$x_0$$, where △x is displacement, $$x_f$$ is the final position, and $$x_0$$ is the initial position.

title: What to Calculate
text: Find the total distance that Bryan flew.

title: Converting Minutes to Seconds
text: In the problem, we are told that Bryan flew $$169$$ minutes at an average velocity of $$3.53$$ $$\frac{meters}{second}$$. In order to calculate the total distance flown, we must calculate how many meters he flew in $$169$$ minutes. First, convert $$169$$ minutes to seconds (remember that $$1$$ minute $$=$$ $$60$$ seconds). What answer do you get?

subHints.title: Calculating the Conversion from Minutes to Seconds
subHints.text: To convert $$169$$ minutes to seconds, you must solve for $$169\times60$$ because $$1$$ minute $$=$$ $$60$$ seconds. What answer do you get?

title: Finding the Distance Flown
text: Now that we have calculated the number of seconds that Bryan flew (10,140 seconds), we can find the total distance flown. We are told that he flew at an average velocity of $$3.53$$ $$\frac{meters}{second}$$. This means that for every second, Bryan flew $$3.53$$ meters. Taking into account the 10,140 seconds that Bryan flew, how many meters did he fly in total?

subHints.title: Meters and Seconds
subHints.text: To find the total distance flown, we must calculate 3.53*10,140 since Bryan flew at an average velocity of $$3.53$$ $$\frac{meters}{second}$$ and flew 10,140 seconds. What answer do you get?

title: Converting Meters to Kilometers
text: The question asks for Bryan's total displacement in kilometers. In reference to the displacement formula, we are solving for △x. $$x_f$$, the final position, is what we just calculated (the total distance flown) and $$x_0$$, the initial position, is $$0$$ since Bryan started at $$0$$ km. As a result, the equation can be simplified to △x $$=$$ $$x_f$$. The last step is to convert the distance flown in meters to kilometers (hint: $$1$$ meter $$=$$ $$0.001$$ kilometers). Remember to round your final answer to the nearest tenths place.

title: Calculating the Conversion from Meters to Kilometers
text: To convert meters to kilometers, we must calculate $$35794.2\times0.001$$ because Bryan traveled $$35794.2$$ meters and $$1$$ meter $$=$$ $$0.001$$ kilometers. What answer do you get? Round to the nearest tenths place.
